title: Deadline Hub
description: Collection of academic deadlines, mostly related to my own research.

title: Fact-Checking Widget
description: Streamlit app that allows users to explore how different OpenAI models fact check news articles. Uses a prompt from DeVerna et al. (2024), PNAS.

title: Facebook News Bridge
description: An AI browser extension, powered by Gemini. Grounded in Google search, the extension allows users to retrieve relevant contextual information about news they encounter on Facebook and even lets users generate bridging responses.

title: Pseudo-profound Bullshit Generator
description: Streamlit app for generating psuedo-profound bullshit with the help of GPT-3.5.

title: AI Persuasion Companion for CMV
description: Streamlit app for retrieving and responding to posts from Reddit's r/changemyview subreddit. Input an OpenAI API key to analyze and respond to posts with GPT-4.

title: Top FIBers
description: The Top FIBers dashboard tracks and reports on the top superspreaders of low-credibility information on Twitter and Facebook each month.

title: US Midterm Elections 2022
description: Multi-platform analysis of information about US 2022 midterm elections.

title: CoVaxxy
description: Visualizing the relationship between COVID-19 vaccine adoption and online (mis)information.

title: OSoMeTweet
description: Python package to work with Twitterâ€™s V2 API. (A bit outdated now, but still useful.)

title: py_misinfo_exposure
description: Python package for calculating a Twitter user's misinformation-exposure score.

title: Clean Academic CV Template
description: Overleaf/LaTeX CV template. Designed to be easy to customize and maintain.
